required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Retinal Health Monitoring System Thickness Module
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Retinal Health Monitoring System - Retinal Thickness Module in Subjects With Normal Macular Thickness and Subjects With Center-involving Macular Edema

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the ability and accuracy of the Retinal Health Monitoring System - Retinal Thickness Module (RHMS - RTM).

detailed_description.textblock: Evaluation of the Retinal Health Monitoring System - Retinal Thickness Module in subjects with normal macular thickness and subjects with center-involving macular edema.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the RHMS-RTM retinal thickness measurements
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the ability of the RHMS-RTM device to measure retinal thickness
To assess repeatability of the RHMS-RTM device

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of retinal thickness measurements between the RHMS-RTM and the SD-OCT
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the agreement of measurements by the RHMS-RTM and SD-OCT

arm_group.description: Subjects with normal macular thickness in one or both eyes.
Subjects with center-involving macular edema due to w/AMD in one or both eyes.
Subjects with center-involving macular edema due to DR or RVO in one or both eyes.

intervention.other_name: Handheld swept source (SS) optical coherence tomography (OCT)

study_pop.textblock: Subjects aged ≥ 18 years old with normal macular thickness, center-involving macular edema due to wAMD, diabetic retinopathy or retinal vein occlusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Corrected visual acuity (VA) of 20/100 or better, in the study eye(s)
2. Media clarity, undilated pupil size, OCT-B scans, axial length measurements in the study eye(s)
3. Able to perform self-testing of retinal thickness with the RHMS-RTM after training
4. Able and willing to give informed consent
5. Group 1:
1. Macula with normal thickness [central subfield thickness (CST) below 305 microns as measured by SD-OCT] in at least one eye
2. Patients with dry AMD are eligible for enrollment into Group 1
3. No history of wet AMD, DR, or RVO in either eye
6. Group 2 and Group 3 (in at least one or the same eye):
1. History of center-involving macular edema due to wet AMD (Group 2); or DR or RVO (Group 3)
2. Macular edema on SD-OCT with CST ≥ 305 microns
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of corneal refractive surgery, photorefractive keratectomy, radial keratotomy, in the study eye
2. History of epiretinal membrane, vitreomacular traction, or macular hole in the study eye(s)
3. Participation in any study using an investigational drug within 30 days or screening or investigational device within 60 days of screening
4. Refractive error: spherical equivalent of > 3 diopters of hyperopia or > 6 diopters of myopia, or > 2 diopters cylinder in the study eye(s)
5. History of photocoagulation laser scar or other retinal scar in the central 3 mm of the macula, in the study eye(s)
